required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020

clinical_study.brief_title: Comprehensive Study on the Quality of Life in Cervical Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Comprehensive Study on the Quality of Life in Cervical Cancer Patients: A Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is prospective cohort study. All the patients with primary cervical cancer in the future three years in Peking Union Medical College Hospital will be included in this study. Before and after the major therapy (including at least radical hysterectomy and/or radiotherapy), the patients accept (1) the questionnaires survey about quality of life; (2) urodynamic testing; (3) rectum dynamics testing and (4) ovarian reserve function. The survival outcomes (disease-free survival and overall survival) will be supplemented as secondary objectives.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up. The standard scores ranges from 0 to 100, and the higher score, the more inferior quality of life.
primary_outcome.description: Scores calculated from European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) QLQ-C30

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up. The standard scores ranges from 0 to 100, and the higher score, the more inferior quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Follicle-stimulating hormone tested in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-mullerian hormone tested in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Inhibin B tested in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Bladder capacity at the first void sense
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bladder capacity at the first void sense tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Bladder capacity at normal desire to void
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bladder capacity at normal desire to void tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Bladder capacity at strong desire to void
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bladder capacity at strong desire to void tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Maximun flow rate tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Average flow rate tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Bladder pressure at maximun flow rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bladder pressure at maximun flow rate tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Detrusor pressure at maximun flow rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Detrusor pressure at maximun flow rate tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Bladder compliance at strong desire to void
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bladder compliance at strong desire to void tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Detrusor compliance at strong desire to void
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Detrusor compliance at strong desire to void tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Residual urine volume tested by urodynamic testing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the baseline of four weeks before major therapy at following-up
secondary_outcome.description: Anal sphincter pressure tested by rectum dynamic testing

intervention.description: Including four kinds of questionnaires: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) QLQ-C30 (V3); EORTC QLQ-CX24; Eligibility Criteria (FSFI); and Short forms of two condition-specific quality-of-life questionnaires for women with pelvic floor disorders (PFIQ-7)

Urodynamic testing consists of important urodynamic parameters including: Bladder capacity at the first void sense Bladder capacity at normal desire to void Bladder capacity at strong desire to void Qmax Qave Pves at Qmax Pdet at Qmax Cves at SDV Cdet at SDV Residual urine volume
Rectum dynamics testing consists of important parameters of rectum activities
Testing for ovarian reserve function consists of: Follicle-stimulating hormone Estradiol Anti-mullerian hormone Inhibin B

biospec_descr.textblock: Peripheral blood samples for the testing of ovarian reserve function

study_pop.textblock: All the patients with primary cervical cancer in the future three years in Peking Union Medical College Hospital will be included in this study. They should be 18 years or older, accepting major therapy (including at least radical hysterectomy and/or radiotherapy) in the study cente and achieving response after the major therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary uterine cervical carcinomas
- Aged 18 or older
- Accepting major therapy (including at least radical hysterectomy and/or radiotherapy) in the study center
- Informed consents delivered
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not meeting any of the inclusion criteria
- Not accepting any of the four kinds of evaluations for quality of life
- Recurrent patients
- Not achieving response after above major therapy
